Articles.Content: Is it possible to make a lander that can land on Tylo, take off again, and achieve orbit all with out staging? I've been messing around with landers and the most dV I can get is about 5000, but because of the design I might have more than that.

Two nuclear engines and 20 FL-T100 equivalents of fuel will give 1.5 tonnes of payload about 6800 m/s of delta-v. TWR is a bit low, but you can land on Tylo with that.

If you want more TWR, try using LV-T30 engines. Two engines, 96 FL-T100 equivalents of fuel (1.5 jumbo tanks), and 3 tonnes of payload will have almost 6000 m/s of delta-v.

The lander can also use 48-7S engines. Four engines, 32 FL-T100 equivalents of fuel, and 1 tonne of payload will also have almost 6000 m/s of delta-v. This design will also have a decent TWR.

For really big single-stage Tylo landers, you should look at the new SLS engines.

Yes - very possible. Have done this twice (some quickload was involved, however, with practice you should be able to do this reliably, every time, just like the Mun).
